Title: US Mission mourns Abubakar Abdullahi, cleric who saved 300 Christians in Plateau
Summary: Abdullahi received the US International Religious Freedom Award in 2019 . In 2019, he received the award in recognition of his decision to risk his life to protect others .

Title: Sanusi appeals to Gov Yusuf to sign death warrants of convicted murderers
Summary: Sanusi appealed to Gov Yusuf to sign death warrants of convicted murderers . The monarch made the call while reacting to the Saturday's gruesome killing of a housewife and her six children in the state .

Title: Local refineries supply 87% of Nigeria’s cooking gas in 2025
Summary: Local refineries and gas processing plants supplied 87% of Nigeria’s domestic Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG), also known as cooking gas, in 2025 . Findings by Vanguard showed that the sharp rise in domestic supply marked a major dependence on imports .

Title: UAE, Nigeria’s economic deal, major strategic milestone — NACCIMA
Summary: The Nigerian Association of Chambers of Commerce, Industry, Mines and Agriculture (NACCIMA) has described the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) between the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Nigeria as a major strategic milestone in Nigeria’s economic transformation agenda . Recall that UAE and Nigeria recently has signed the CEPA deal

Title: Dollar to Naira exchange rate today, January 21, 2026
Summary: The Nigerian Naira maintained a stable trajectory against the United States Dollar during the mid-week trading session, reflecting the positive sentiment surrounding the Central Bank of Nigeria’s (CBN) 2026 macroeconomic outlook .

Title: COAS promises continous deployment of troops to Plateau
Summary: Lt. Gen. Waidi Shaibu promised to continue to deploy personnel and operational resources to address security challenges on the Plateau and other parts of the country . He gave the assurance on Tuesday during a courtesy visit to the Governor, Caleb Mutfwang, as part of his operational and familiarisation tour of Army formations in the state

Title: Give tax reforms human face, Catholic bishops tell FG
Summary: Catholic bishops of the Ibadan Ecclesiastical Province have urged the Federal Government to implement ongoing tax reforms with fairness, transparency and compassion . The call was contained in a communiqué issued on Tuesday at the end of the bishops’ first provincial meeting for 2026 . The bishops urged Nigerians not to lose hope, encouraging them to

Title: Masari’s ex-CoS dumps APC for ADC in Katsina
Summary: Almustapha Saulawa has defected from the ruling All Progressives Congress to the opposition African Democratic Congress . He said his decision was guided by principle and a desire to “rescue” Katsina State . Saulawa announced his defection on Tuesday at the ADC Secretariat in Katsina, where he formally registered as

Title: PDP crisis: Court dimisses Anyanwu’s suit
Summary: The Federal High Court in Abuja, on Tuesday, dismissed the fresh suit filed by a factional National Secretary of the Peoples Democratic Party, Senator Samuel Anyanwu, after he applied to withdraw the matter . Title: Abiodun unveils train station road, plans 20 more
Summary: Ogun State Governor, Prince Dapo Abiodun, unveiled the Laderin–Prof. Wole Soyinka Train Station Road in Abeokuta, the state capital, on Tuesday . The state was created on February 13, 1976 by the military government of late Gen. Murtala Muhammed alongside others including Oyo
